You also might consider using Dual Channel to encode in mext time as mp3 stereo isn't true stereo, it's much better than joint stereo, but only dual channe (dual stereo)l has separate left and right channels.

the posting went in under music. There is no designation n that area for flac versus mp3 - as such Ive never had to specify that I use only mp3s

There is a different category altogether called flac which appears as an option just as movies or music - but that doesn't make sense to me. If its flac music rather than mp3 music - its still music and that's where the distinction should appear. most converters provide a choice between stereo and joint stereo. I use full stereo only - unless I come across the material in joint stereo in which case I tend to go along as almost everything Ive found on the net is invariably joint stereo including many if not most of the most current torrents posted on this board and everywhere as a result

Forget about this posting, go to http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6354387/Joe_Cocker_-_Unchain_My_Heart_%28FLAC%29 instead for the full album. I don't see the use in posting single tracks anyway especially when the track is available on a CD album. Post the full album instead!

Reading your last post I've come to the conclusion that you don't even understand the difference between a flac and a mp3.

All your other mp3 torrents are correctly put into music category, since 99% of users use mp3. Flac is a niche market and somehow your mp3 torrent made it into the flac category, most likely by an accidental click of your mouse.

It's not the niggest of deal but your justification of a mp3 in the flac category is troubling. The truth is it could be reported and either deleted or moved into the appropriate cat.

And please, I come to this flac cat to browse for FLAC files... not mp3's.
